internal.content: --- title: Windows Users - Demo Preparation description: Cloud Pak for Integration for Windows Users - Demo Preparation --- ![banner](./images/low-code-banner.jpg) 1 - Provision a Red Hat VDI 2 - Access your Linux Desktop 3 - Access your CP4I environment *** ### 1 - Provision a Red Hat VDI This documentations is only for Windows users, who wants to install CP4I environment. The Demo Preparation document of different Integration Sales Enablement course uses pre-created script to install CP4I and other integration software. These scripts are available for MAC OS and Linux users. If you are a Windows user and would like to install your CP4I, you have some possibilities to do it: 1) Request a MAC OS/Linux friend to execute the Demo Preparation script for you. 2) Try to use linux emulator in your Windows machine. 3) Or request a Linux Virtual Machine desktop on TechZone and execute the demo script from there. This section describes the approach 3, about how to provision a Linux VDI. 1.1 To deploy your Linux VDI on TechZone, go here. Select if you prefer to make a reservation now or schedule for later. ![](images/request-vdi-1.png) 1.2 If you do not have a sales opportunity, select the purpose **Education** (A) for a 2-day reservation (which can be extended without any approvals) and fill in the **Purpose description** (B). ![](images/request-vdi-2.png) 1.3 Select the **Preferred Geography** (A), and accept the terms and conditions (B) and click **Submit** (C). ![](images/request-vdi-3.png) 1.4 You will receive a few emails as the provisioning process continues. You should expect the final email to be sent after 30 minutes or less. The final email should look similar to the following. ![](images/request-vdi-4.png) *** ### 2 - Access your Linux Desktop In this section, you access your OpenShift cluster and install the OpenShift command line tool. 2.1 Open the **Reservation ID** link that was included in the "Reservation Ready on IBM Technology Zone" email. ![](images/access-vdi-1.png) 2.2 Scroll down to the *Virtual Machines** section and click on **Console** button. ![](images/access-vdi-2.png) 2.3 Click **Open in a new window**. ![](images/access-vdi-3.png) 2.4 Select **ibmuser**. ![](images/access-vdi-4.png) 2.5 Enter **passw0rd** as password. ![](images/access-vdi-5.png) 2.6 Here you have your linux desktop. This VDI has **oc CLI** and **git** installed. Check your course pre-requisites if you need to install any other tool. To follow with your demo preparation, just open the **Terminal** and follow the steps from your demo preparation document. ![](images/access-vdi-6.png) 2.7 If you need to copy command from your host machine to virtual machine, you can use the **send text** button. ![](images/access-vdi-7.png) `Note:` If your demo preparation includes steps that only uses browser, you can use your hostmachine (Windows) to do it.
